data.title: WEDDINGS; Laura Anthony, Philip Johnston
data.text:
Laura de Bonneville Anthony and Philip Connelly Johnston were married yesterday by the Rev. Thomas Twomey at St. Edwards Church in Palm Beach, Fla.

The bride, who graduated from Trinity College in Hartford, and the bridegroom, a cum laude graduate of the University of Michigan, received master's degrees in international relations from the Johns Hopkins School of Advanced International Studies.

The bride, 35, worked until last fall for Leafstone, an agency in New York, organizing conferences across the country for hedge fund managers. Her father, the late Roscoe T. Anthony Jr., was a real estate salesman for Anthony Real Estate in Palm Beach, a family company now defunct. Her mother, the late Bettina Moran Anthony, was a saleswoman for Prudential Florida Realty, also in Palm Beach.

The bridegroom, 33, is a law clerk in Miami to Judge Joan A. Lenard of United States District Court in Miami. He received a law degree from Columbia. He is the son of Suzanne and John M. Johnston of Key Colony Beach, Fla. His mother retired as a manager at Sotheby's International Realty in New York. His father, also retired, was a partner in White & Case, the New York law firm, and led its litigation department.
